\code{nested\_dict} extends \code{defaultdict} to support python \code{dict} with multiple levels of nested-ness:


\chapter{Drop in replacement for \texttt{dict}}
\label{index:nested-dict}\label{index:drop-in-replacement-for-dict}\begin{quote}

\begin{Verbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]

\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{nd}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s}{two}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+s}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s}{1 / 2}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZdq{}}

\chapter{Specifying the contained type}
\label{index:specifying-the-contained-type}\begin{quote}
\begin{description}
\item[{If you want the nested dictionary to hold}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
a collection (like the \href{https://docs.python.org/2/library/sets.html}{set} in the first example) or

\item {} 
a scalar with useful default values such as \code{int} or \code{str}.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}
\end{quote}

\chapter{Iterating through \texttt{nested\_dict}}
\label{index:iterating-through-nested-dict}
Iterating through deep or unevenly nested dictionaries is a bit of a pain without recursion.
\code{nested dict} allows you to \textbf{flatten} the nested levels into \href{https://docs.python.org/2/library/functions.html\#tuple}{tuple}s before iteration.

You do not need to know beforehand how many levels of nesting you have:
\begin{quote}

\begin{Verbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k+kn}{from} \PYG{n+nn}{nested\PYGZus{}dict} \PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{nested\PYGZus{}dict}
\PYG{n}{nd}\PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{nested\PYGZus{}dict}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n}{nd}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s}{one}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+s}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s}{1}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZdq{}}
\PYG{n}{nd}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s}{two}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+s}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s}{1 / 2}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZdq{}}
\PYG{n}{nd}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s}{uno}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s}{three}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+s}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s}{1 / 2 / 3}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZdq{}}

\PYG{k}{for} \PYG{n}{keys\PYGZus{}as\PYGZus{}tuple}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{value} \PYG{o+ow}{in} \PYG{n}{nd}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{items\PYGZus{}flat}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{k}{print} \PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+si}{\PYGZpc{}\PYGZhy{}20s}\PYG{l+s}{ == }\PYG{l+s+si}{\PYGZpc{}r}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZdq{}} \PYG{o}{\PYGZpc{}} \PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{keys\PYGZus{}as\PYGZus{}tuple}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{value}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{c}{\PYGZsh{}   (1, \PYGZsq{}two\PYGZsq{})           == \PYGZsq{}1 / 2\PYGZsq{}}
\PYG{c}{\PYGZsh{}   (\PYGZsq{}one\PYGZsq{},)             == \PYGZsq{}1\PYGZsq{}}
\PYG{c}{\PYGZsh{}   (\PYGZsq{}uno\PYGZsq{}, 2, \PYGZsq{}three\PYGZsq{})  == \PYGZsq{}1 / 2 / 3\PYGZsq{}}
\end{Verbatim}
\end{quote}
\begin{description}
\item[{nested\_dict provides}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
{\hyperref[nested_dict:items-flat]{\emph{\DUspan{}{items\_flat()}}}}

\item {} 
{\hyperref[nested_dict:keys-flat]{\emph{\DUspan{}{keys\_flat()}}}}

\item {} 
{\hyperref[nested_dict:values-flat]{\emph{\DUspan{}{values\_flat()}}}}

\end{itemize}

\end{description}

({\hyperref[nested_dict:iteritems-flat]{\emph{\DUspan{}{iteritems\_flat()}}}}, {\hyperref[nested_dict:iterkeys-flat]{\emph{\DUspan{}{iterkeys\_flat()}}}}, and {\hyperref[nested_dict:itervalues-flat]{\emph{\DUspan{}{itervalues\_flat()}}}} are python 2.7-style synonyms. )


\chapter{Converting to / from dictionaries}
\label{index:converting-to-from-dictionaries}
The magic of  \code{nested\_dict} sometimes gets in the way (of \href{https://docs.python.org/2/library/pickle.html}{pickle}ing for example).
\begin{description}
\item[{We can convert to and from a vanilla python \code{dict} using}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
{\hyperref[nested_dict:to-dict]{\emph{\DUspan{}{nested\_dict.to\_dict()}}}}

\item {} 
{\hyperref[nested_dict:nested-dict-init]{\emph{\DUspan{}{nested\_dict constructor}}}}

\end{itemize}

\begin{Verbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{k+kn}{from} \PYG{n+nn}{nested\PYGZus{}dict} \PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{nested\PYGZus{}dict}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{nd}\PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{nested\PYGZus{}dict}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{nd}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s}{one}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{1}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{nd}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s}{two}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+s}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s}{1 / 2}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZdq{}}

\PYG{g+go}{\PYGZsh{}}
\PYG{g+go}{\PYGZsh{}   convert nested\PYGZus{}dict \PYGZhy{}\PYGZgt{} dict and pickle}
\PYG{g+go}{\PYGZsh{}}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{nd}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{to\PYGZus{}dict}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{g+go}{\PYGZob{}1: \PYGZob{}\PYGZsq{}two\PYGZsq{}: \PYGZsq{}1 / 2\PYGZsq{}\PYGZcb{}, \PYGZsq{}one\PYGZsq{}: 1\PYGZcb{}}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n+nn}{pickle}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{binary\PYGZus{}representation} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{pickle}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{dumps}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{nd}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{to\PYGZus{}dict}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{g+go}{\PYGZsh{}}
\PYG{g+go}{\PYGZsh{}   convert dict \PYGZhy{}\PYGZgt{} nested\PYGZus{}dict}
\PYG{g+go}{\PYGZsh{}}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{normal\PYGZus{}dict} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{pickle}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{loads}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{binary\PYGZus{}representation}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{new\PYGZus{}nd} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{nested\PYGZus{}dict}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{normal\PYGZus{}dict}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{nd} \PYG{o}{==} \PYG{n}{new\PYGZus{}nd}
\PYG{g+go}{True}
\end{Verbatim}

\end{description}


\chapter{\texttt{defaultdict}}
\label{index:defaultdict}
\code{nested\_dict} extends \href{https://docs.python.org/2/library/collections.html\#collections.defaultdict}{collections.defaultdict}

You can get arbitrarily-nested ``auto-vivifying'' dictionaries using \href{https://docs.python.org/2/library/collections.html\#collections.defaultdict}{defaultdict}.
\begin{quote}

\begin{Verbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k+kn}{from} \PYG{n+nn}{collections} \PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{defaultdict}
\PYG{n}{nested\PYGZus{}dict} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{k}{lambda}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{defaultdict}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{nested\PYGZus{}dict}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n}{nd} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{nested\PYGZus{}dict}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n}{nd}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s}{three}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mi}{4}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{5}
\PYG{n}{nd}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s}{one}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s}{two}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s}{three}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mi}{4}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{5}
\end{Verbatim}
\end{quote}

However, only \code{nested\_dict} supports a \code{dict} of \code{dict} of \code{sets} etc.


\section{nested\_dict}
\label{nested_dict:nested-dict}\label{nested_dict::doc}\label{nested_dict:module-nested_dict}\index{nested\_dict (module)}

\subsection{Class documentation}
\label{nested_dict:class-documentation}\index{nested\_dict (class in nested\_dict)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{nested_dict:nested_dict.nested_dict}\pysigline{\strong{class }\code{nested\_dict.}\bfcode{nested\_dict}}
\end{fulllineitems}

\phantomsection\label{nested_dict:nested-dict-init}\begin{quote}
\index{\_\_init\_\_() (nested\_dict.nested\_dict method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{nested_dict:nested_dict.nested_dict.__init__}\pysiglinewithargsret{\code{nested\_dict.}\bfcode{\_\_init\_\_}}{\optional{\emph{existing\_dict \textbar{} nested\_level}, \emph{value\_type}}}{}~\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\textbf{\texttt{existing\_dict}} -- an existing \code{dict} to be converted into a \code{nested\_dict}

\item {} 
\textbf{\texttt{nested\_level}} -- the level of nestedness in the dictionary

\item {} 
\textbf{\texttt{collection\_type}} -- the type of the values held in the dictionary

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

For example,
\begin{quote}

\begin{Verbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{a} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{nested\PYGZus{}dict}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{3}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n+nb}{list}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n}{a}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s}{level 1}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s}{level 2}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s}{level 3}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{append}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{n}{b} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{nested\PYGZus{}dict}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n+nb}{int}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n}{b}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s}{level 1}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s}{level 2}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{o}{+}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{3}
\end{Verbatim}
\end{quote}

If nested\_level and value\_type are not defined, the degree of nested-ness is not
fixed. For example,
\begin{quote}

\begin{Verbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{a} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{nested\PYGZus{}dict}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n}{a}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s}{1}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s}{2}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s}{3}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{3}
\PYG{n}{a}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s}{A}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s}{B}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{15}
\end{Verbatim}
\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\end{quote}

\phantomsection\label{nested_dict:items-flat}\begin{quote}

\begin{fulllineitems}

iterate through values with nested keys flattened into a tuple

For example,
\begin{quote}

\begin{Verbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k+kn}{from} \PYG{n+nn}{nested\PYGZus{}dict} \PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{nested\PYGZus{}dict}
\PYG{n}{a} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{nested\PYGZus{}dict}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n}{a}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s}{1}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s}{2}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s}{3}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{3}
\PYG{n}{a}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s}{A}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s}{B}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{15}
\end{Verbatim}

print list(a.items\_flat())
\end{quote}

Produces:
\begin{quote}

\begin{Verbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]

        \PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s}{A}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s}{B}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{,}        \PYG{l+m+mi}{15}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{p}{]}
\end{Verbatim}
\end{quote}

\begin{Verbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]

\PYG{n}{a} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{nested\PYGZus{}dict}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n}{a}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s}{1}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s}{2}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s}{3}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{3}
\PYG{n}{a}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s}{A}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s}{B}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{15}

\PYG{k}{print} \PYG{n+nb}{list}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{a}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{values\PYGZus{}flat}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{Verbatim}
\end{quote}

\phantomsection\label{nested_dict:to-dict}\begin{quote}
\index{to\_dict() (in module nested\_dict)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{nested_dict:nested_dict.to_dict}\pysiglinewithargsret{\code{nested\_dict.}\bfcode{to\_dict}}{}{}
Converts the nested dictionary to a nested series of standard \code{dict} objects

For example,
\begin{quote}

\begin{Verbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k+kn}{from} \PYG{n+nn}{nested\PYGZus{}dict} \PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{nested\PYGZus{}dict}
\PYG{n}{a} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{nested\PYGZus{}dict}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n}{a}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s}{1}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s}{2}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s}{3}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{3}
\PYG{n}{a}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s}{A}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s}{B}\PYG{l+s}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{15}

\PYG{k}{print} \PYG{n}{a}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{to\PYGZus{}dict}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{Verbatim}
\end{quote}
\begin{description}
\item[{Produces:}] \leavevmode
\begin{Verbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]

\index{\_\_str\_\_() (in module nested\_dict)}

The dictionary formatted as a string
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode
\textbf{\texttt{indent}} -- The level of indentation for each nested level

\end{description}\end{quote}
